Machine-Readable Bibliographic Data Bases .A Gechman, Marvin C. The advent of machine-readable data bases is one of the most significant forward steps in information retrieval.. Currently, the creation and application of these data bases are in a period of very rapid growth.. This reviewer sees a great need for a review of "what is going on" because there is so much going on.. It is the goal of this chapter to fulfill that need even though it is difficult to hold this dynamic field static for a good meaningful look.. .X 18	2	125 121	1	125 124	1	125 125	7	125 127	2	125 129	2	125 145	2	125 165	1	125 211	1	125 307	1	125 363	1	125 378	1	125 381	1	125 432	1	125 440	1	125 448	1	125 452	2	125 453	1	125 460	1	125 461	1	125 467	1	125 468	1	125 484	1	125 495	1	125 506	1	125 508	1	125 511	2	125 512	1	125 514	1	125 516	1	125 517	1	125 518	1	125 520	1	125 521	2	125 522	1	125 523	2	125 524	1	125 526	2	125 527	1	125 528	2	125 529	1	125 575	1	125 576	1	125 580	2	125 604	1	125 609	1	125 610	1	125 611	1	125 612	2	125 615	1	125 619	1	125 622	2	125 623	1	125 625	1	125 626	1	125 629	1	125 631	1	125 632	1	125 633	1	125 636	1	125 642	1	125 643	1	125 644	1	125 645	1	125 646	1	125 649	1	125 650	1	125 699	1	125 700	2	125 705	2	125 707	2	125 708	1	125 723	1	125 726	1	125 727	2	125 728	1	125 729	1	125 730	1	125 731	1	125 736	1	125 737	1	125 738	1	125 739	1	125 740	1	125 741	1	125 743	1	125 754	2	125 812	2	125 813	1	125 814	1	125 817	1	125 820	1	125 822	1	125 824	1	125 866	1	125 870	1	125 873	1	125 875	1	125 1078	1	125 1089	1	125 1091	1	125 1143	3	125 1264	1	125 1302	1	125 1303	2	125 1327	1	125 1364	1	125 1366	3	125 1367	4	125 1368	3	125 1374	2	125 1376	2	125 1396	1	125 1396	1	125
